definitions.definition: A room in a church where the clergy put on their vestments and where these are stored; also used for meetings and classes; a sacristy.
definitions.example: The choirboys change into their cassocks in the vestry.

definitions.definition: A committee of parishioners elected to administer the temporal affairs of a parish.
definitions.example: The vestry meets on the first Tuesday of every month.

definitions.definition: An assembly of persons who manage parochial affairs; so called because usually held in a vestry.
